result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
2:17 PM Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Roberto Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Kari Hoffman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:39 AM Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Roberto Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Kimberly A Hardtke in court for the State of Wisconsin. No interpreter available.  Present bond continued
Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Roberto Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Court accepts waiver and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond modification requested. State opposes with argument. Court denies bond modification.
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:47 AM Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Amaro Lopez in court for Roberto Rodriguez.  Attorney Dana Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lopez recently appointed and had an opportunity to speak with his client in court today.  Attorney Lopez does not beleive competency is an issue.  Present bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

*******COURT APPOINTED ATTORNEY*****
Defendant to pay: $ 0.00 - Defendant qualifies for Public Defender. Court appoints counsel
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:51 AM Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Kim Hardtke in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lopez will take the cases, however unable to jump on zoom this morning.  Competency was not addressed at todays hearing.  Bail/bond will be argued at next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Caleb Saunders in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court, in custody at Brown County Jail.  Attorney Brittany Van Rite in court and appears on behalf of SPD to assist for Roberto Rodriguez. 
Court uncomfortable to accept waiver and sends up to the branch for competency hearing
Present bond continued

Assistant District Attorney Natalie Mulvey appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Roberto Rodriguez in court via zoom from BCJ, assisted by Spanish interpreter Mario Tapia. 
Bond modification denied. Bond argument reserved for counsel. 
Present bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to report to CJS within 24 hours of court or release from custody. 
Defendant not to operate motor vehicle without valid driver license

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
